intro: Goniolimon tataricum subsp. italicum, commonly known as the Italian tatarian goniolimon, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
